content: this legal case involves a dispute over coownership of a property the court determined that a physical division of the property was not possible and decided to sell it through a public auction the proceeds would be divided among the coowners according to their shares the defendants objected to the division method proposed by the expert but the court found that a geometric division was feasible the court also considered the maintenance costs and the legalization process of the buildings on the property the proceedings were interrupted due to the death of one of the defendants but later resumed the plaintiff requested that the defendants recognize and allow the division of the property and proposed to pay them for their shares the defendants agreed to the division and payment but the second defendant proposed to be given one parcel of the property in exchange for their share the court dissolved the coownership and determined the shares and market values of the properties the plaintiff was required to pay the defendants different amounts of money the court ordered the defendants to bear the costs of the plaintiffs legal representation the case has been ongoing since august 28 2014 and the court has determined the necessary costs of the proceedings
